column4: Good evening! I have a notebook with Video Card from SIS 771/671 PCIE VGA Display Adapter, and I would like to know how to reduce the bright of the screen
try the fn key and the arrow keys
look in power management preferences, there is a slider there
mine doesn't work on my netbook when plugged into a monitor otherwise it does
the slider doesn't appear in the power management, i'm using Ubuntu 11.04. In my Debian appear this slider, but doesn't work
you don't see this?  http://imagebin.org/169701
no, i don't, but in Debian I see, but doesn't work
you keep mentioning Debian why?  The picture I posted is from 11.04, the unity desktop, but the classic is the same.
what desktop are you using?
what OS are we dealing with right now and what desktop?
now I'm using Ubuntu 11.04 and my PC are a notebook... can I send in private the lshw output to you?
can you answer my question of the desktop?
do not pm me and go to the correct channel you are evading a simple question.
Here are my desktop description http://paste.ubuntu.com/675037/
was this your question?
no and I'm done here.
sorry, I don't understand what do you mean with Desktop
is it ubutnu, kubuntu, lubuntu, xubuntu?
Oh, I use Ubuntu, with Gnome
I can't really help you, I showed you a app that should be just like mine that isn't so I know not what else to do.
thank you for your attention!
